sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The max function is used to find the maximum of two numbers (the two expn's). For example, max ( 5, 7 ) is 7. If both numbers are int, the result is int. If both numbers are nat (natural numbers), the result is nat. But if one or both of the numbers are real, the result is real. See also the min function.
sections.text_content: The max function is used to find the maximum of two numbers (the two expn's). For example, max ( 5, 7 ) is 7. If both numbers are int, the result is int. If both numbers are nat (natural numbers), the result is nat. But if one or both of the numbers are real, the result is real. See also the min function.
sections.mdown_content: The **max** function is used to find the maximum of two numbers (the two _expn_'s). For example, **max** ( 5, 7 ) is 7. If both numbers are **int**, the result is **int**. If both numbers are **nat** (natural numbers), the result is **nat**. But if one or both of the numbers are **real**, the result is **real**. See also the **min** function.

sections.title: Example
code:
var x : real := 74.61
        var y : real := 85.72
        put max ( x, y )        % Outputs 85.72

sections.title: Example
code:
var m, t : real
        get m           % Input first number
        for i : 2 .. 10     % Handle remaining 9 numbers
            get t
            m := max ( m, t )
        end for
        put "The maximum is ", m
sections.raw_content: This program inputs 10 numbers and outputs their maximum.
sections.text_content: This program inputs 10 numbers and outputs their maximum.
sections.mdown_content: This program inputs 10 numbers and outputs their maximum.
